title: Pope Francis in critical condition after severe respiratory crisis, Vatican says
summary: Pope Francis remains in critical condition after suffering a prolonged asthmatic respiratory crisis amid a complex lung infection, the Vatican announced Saturday. The 88-year-old pontiff, who is conscious but in pain, is receiving high-flow oxygen and blood transfusions as doctors monitor the risk of sepsis, a potentially fatal complication.

title: In Israel, the tragedy of the Bibas family overshadows the release of six hostages
summary: Hamas released six men, two of whom had been held in Gaza for over 10 years, while Israel was to release 620 Palestinian prisoners. The exact circumstances surrounding the death of Shiri Bibas, whose body has been returned, and her two young children remain unclear.

title: 'Act of terror' leaves one dead, two injured in eastern France
summary: A knife attack in the eastern French city of Mulhouse left one person dead and two police officers seriously wounded on Saturday, with President Emmanuel Macron denouncing it as an 'Islamist terror act.' The suspect, a 37-year-old Algerian man on a terror watchlist, was taken into custody.

title: France says escaped convict in prison van attack arrested in Romania
summary: Mohamed Amra had vanished without a trace after an attack with military-grade assault weapons on a prison van carrying him in the Normandy region.

title: Paris' Musée Picasso brings Nazi-hated art to light
summary: Based on recent discoveries, the Parisian museum evokes the defamatory exhibition organized in Munich in 1937 at Hitler's request, bringing together works stigmatized by the Third Reich in a new exhibition that opened on February 18.

title: A look back at Germany's lightning election campaign
summary: Triggered after the breakdown of the coalition led by Social Democrat Chancellor Olaf Scholz, the campaign for the February 23 parliamentary elections has been marked by terror attacks and interference from the Trump administration.

title: Brazil's Lula grapples with opposing climate and economic goals
summary: Brazil's president has positioned himself as a leader in the green transition for developing countries and has implemented multiple decarbonization measures. However, he also supports an energy policy based on fossil fuel extraction, seen as essential for the country's economic development.

title: Documentary describing how PM Orban's family became so wealthy attracts millions of viewers in Hungary
summary: 'The Dynasty' effectively traces how those close to the Hungarian prime minister have become miraculously wealthy alongside his political career for at least 15 years.

title: Trump orders tighter curbs on Chinese investments in key sectors
summary: The US president signed a memo calling for curbs on Chinese investments in sectors like technology, critical infrastructure and health care. Beijing said that the move was 'discriminatory.'

title: Behind the words of JD Vance's historic Munich speech
summary: On February 14, at the Munich Security Conference, US Vice President JD Vance violently attacked European democracy.  Le Monde publishes his speech in full, with added context and explanation.

title: Arab countries outline plan for rebuilding Gaza
summary: Ahead of an Arab League summit on March 4, representatives from the Gulf States, Egypt and Jordan discussed a plan for rebuilding the enclave in three stages, and for governance without Hamas or the Palestinian Authority.

title: 'Forced abroad, Russian oligarchs are repatriating their money and investing it in luxury real estate in Moscow'
summary: The price of high-end housing in the Russian capital rose by more than 20% in 2024 and is now approaching €20,000 per square meter, writes Le Monde's Philippe Escande in his column.

title: Starlink conquers the African internet market
summary: Elon Musk's satellite operator is multiplying its partnerships on the continent with the world's poorest web coverage, raising the fears of local operators and certain governments.

title: Argentina: A country that has become expensive for everyone, from locals to tourists and businesses
summary: The peso rose sharply against the dollar in 2024, causing a significant drop in tourism. The government maintains it will not devalue the currency.

title: Elephant seals, sentinels of the ocean's depths
summary: The population fluctuations of these marine mammals reveal a connection between the abundance of their prey and biophysical oscillations in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Steve Bannon after Jordan Bardella's Washington speech cancelled: 'It means he's not fit to lead'
summary: The RN president canceled his appearance at CPAC after a 'gesture alluding to Nazi ideology' performed by the former special adviser to Donald Trump.

title: Agriculture: A different model is possible
summary: Farmers' anger is often the expression of a legitimate feeling of abandonment by public authorities. Rather than give in to the demagoguery of a return to the past, we need to encourage initiatives to adapt to climate change.

title: Anthropologist Michel Agier: 'Biological race does not exist, but race produced by racism does exist socially'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the anthropologist analyzes the underlying racist mentality which, in his view, is part of Europe's colonial and imperial history.
